name: Palliative Care
description: Palliative Care – often referred to as “Comfort Care” – is designed to relieve the symptoms and stress of living with a serious, life-limiting illness, thus improving quality of life. It meets the unique needs of patients who fall between skilled home health care and hospice. Since Palliative Care is not dependent on a terminal diagnosis, the patient may begin or continue curative treatments such as radiation, blood transfusions, or chemotherapy while under palliative management.
